channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Candise Lin Became the Unofficial Ambassador of Chinese Internet Culture
item.description: Long before TikTok refugees discovered Red Note, Candise Lin was giving Americans a portal into the wild, hilarious world of Chinese social media.

item.title: Google’s Gemini now lets you ask questions using videos and what’s on your screen
item.description: Google is adding new features to its AI assistant, Gemini, that let users ask it questions using video and content on the screen in real time. At the ...

item.title: Signal is the number-one downloaded app in the Netherlands. But why?
item.description: Privacy-focused messaging app Signal has been flying high in the Dutch app stores this past month, often sitting at the top as the most downloaded fre...

item.title: This Modular Phone Concept Is Xiaomi’s Plan to Kill the Camera Bump
item.description: If you hate the big camera bump of today's smartphones, you'll love the detachable lens of Xiaomi’s Modular Optical System.

item.title: Honor's New AI Agent Can Read and Understand Your Screen
item.description: The Honor UI Agent—powered by Google's Gemini 2 model—gives a glimpse of artificial intelligence agents on Android.

item.title: Flora is building an AI-powered ‘infinite canvas’ for creative professionals
item.description: With just a few words, AI models can be prompted to create a story, an image, or even a short film. But according to Weber Wong, these models are all ...

item.title: Lenovo's Latest Laptop Concept Has a Screen That Can Flip and Fold
item.description: At Mobile World Congress 2025, the company also teased a solar-powered laptop and an accessory that adds two extra screens to your portable PC.

item.title: 14 Best Office Chairs of 2025— I've Tested 55+ to Pick Them
item.description: Sitting at a desk for hours? Upgrade your WFH setup and work in style with these comfy WIRED-tested seats.

item.title: Uber is piloting accounts for teenagers in India
item.description: Uber has started testing its teenagers-focused service, Uber for Teens, in India. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple might not release a truly ‘modernized’ Siri until 2027
item.description: Apple is struggling to rebuild Siri for the age of generative AI, according to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, who says the company might not release “a true...
